column4: Where can i get the Windows Media 8 Decoder for ubuntu/rythm box etc
Where can i get the Windows Media 8 Decoder for ubuntu/rythm box etc
try mediubuntu repos
i have the medibuntu repos installed
aptitude search media results no codec packs :(
you didnt read the link ubottu gave you
A that how to is useless... well at least with Totem. B i already did that long ago and still no avail
following the howto guide and reinstalling the restrict codecs 2 or 10 times doesnt change the fact that even still things dont work :(
did you go look at mediubuntu like i had said?
or even the link that was given to you from ubottu it will tell you what to install and from where to get it
Let me double check because i am sure i have the repos on here
I do have the mediabutu repos installed...
did you look at the libs to install from the wiki link?
I have installed all the libs, and apt files from that link at least 5 times. How can i make that more clear ?
if it is not working in any media player than you do not have the correct ones or at least not all of them
Well this origional question was Rythmbox as it offers library support
I stand corrected on the mediabuntu ... I have the software center added for it but it only has 8 files listed :(
i dont have a problem with rythmbox playing mp3 or any other extensions that i have
dont use softwarecenter use synaptic
software center works great for our supported packages but not so well on unsupport packages
BLAH i said I stood corrected :)
